channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-962] “Cycle found” with Spring Data Mongo 1.5
item.description:
Similar to https://jira.spring.io/browse/DATAMONGO-949

Error raised during application loading:

Caused by: org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CyclicPropertyReferenceException: Found cycle for field 'rules' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter.rules'
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CycleGuard.protect(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:370) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$2.doWithPersistentProperty(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:144) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$2.doWithPersistentProperty(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:138) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
at org.springframework.data.mapping.model.BasicPersistentEntity.doWithProperties(BasicPersistentEntity.java:294) ~[spring-data-commons-1.8.0.RELEASE.jar:na]

Objects involved:

@Document(collection="rules")
 
public class Rule {
 
 
 
    @Id private String id;
 
 
 
    private String name;
 
 
 
    // other fields
 
 
 
    private Filter filter;
 
 
 
}
 
 
 
public class Filter {
 
 
 
    // for groups
 
    private String condition;
 
 
 
    private List<Filter> rules = new ArrayList<Filter>();
 
 
 
 
 
    // for query
 
    private String field;
 
 
 
    private String value;
 
 
 
}

The Filter.rules list might have a cyclic reference, and in that case a error must be thrown. But the same structure should work perfectly when there are no cycles. At least Spring could log a warning in that case, but the application must run.

Spring Data MongoDB 1.4.2 accepts this pattern without error nor warnings

In my case these objects are only created from an JSON input, so no cycle possible.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Given the structure outlined above I am unfortunately not able to reproduce the error on the current 1.5.x an 1.6 branches. 

/**
 
 * @see DATAMONGO-962
 
 */
 
@Test
 
public void shouldNotThrowErrorOnPotentialCyclicPropertyReferences() {
 
 
 
	MongoMappingContext mappingContext = new MongoMappingContext();
 
	mappingContext.setInitialEntitySet(new HashSet<Class<?>>(Arrays.<Class<?>> asList(Rule.class, Filter.class)));
 
	mappingContext.initialize();
 
 
 
	new MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver(mappingContext).resolveIndexForClass(Rule.class);
 
}
 
 
 
@Document(collection = "rules")
 
static class Rule {
 
 
 
	@Id private String id;
 
 
 
	private String name;
 
 
 
	// other fields
 
 
 
	private Filter filter;
 
 
 
}
 
 
 
static class Filter {
 
 
 
	// for groups
 
	private String condition;
 
 
 
	private List<Filter> rules = new ArrayList<Filter>();
 
 
 
	// for query
 
	private String field;
 
 
 
	private String value;
 
 
 
}

Maybe I am missing something. Can you set up a testcase reproducing the error?
Yeah, this pretty much looks like a duplicate of DATAMONGO-949, which has already been fixed in the master and bugfix branch. @mistic100 - would you mind giving the snapshots a spin?

I don't think it a the same... I don't see any potential cyclic reference in his code, where there is obviously one in mine.
I already tested with 1.5.1 snapshot without any change.
I'll try to reproduce in independent test case

I created a simple app reproducing the error https://github.com/mistic100/yolo-octo-wallhack

I suspect a problem with Lombok as it's the only "strange" thing, I'll test tomorrow without

thanks mistic100 for setting up the sample - It's having filter twice which causes the trouble. 

Filter filterA;
 
Filter filterB;

Good catch - thanks for reporting!
my bad I should have kept the exact POJO in the bug report, for my defence it's very unexpected

I'll give a try to the snapshot on Monday.

(happy to see such an efficient support team !)

Tested the latest 1.5.1, it works perfectly.
With two warnings in the log

09:53:51.052 WARN o.s.d.m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filterA'
09:53:51.052 WARN o.s.d.m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filterB'

Thank you

The issue still exists in 1.6.0.M1 and BUILD-SNAPSHOT. It can be reproduced with Chris's test case in the comment dated 24/Jun/14 11:15 PM.

Here's the output I got:

Version 1.5.1.RELEASE (no errors)
12:39:11.440 [main] WARN o.s.d.m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter'

Version 1.6.0.M1
12:39:56.487 [main] WARN o.s.d.m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter'
org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CyclicPropertyReferenceException: Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter'
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CycleGuard.protect(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:461) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.6.0.M1.jar:na]
...
12:39:56.503 [main] WARN o.s.d.m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter'

Version 1.6.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT
12:41:59.518 [main] WARN o.s.d.m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter'
org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CyclicPropertyReferenceException: Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter'
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CycleGuard.protect(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:461) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.6.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
12:41:59.518 [main] WARN o.s.d.m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'condition' in type 'Filter' for path 'filter'
Was it just a warning? The test (above) actually passed. And my app looks fine, except I saw a bunch of exceptions when it started up.

Hi,
This issue is not solved. I've a cycle warning with BigDecimal... Could you please open this issue again?

WARN : org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver - Found cycle for field 'intVal' in type 'BigDecimal' for path 'b'
org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CyclicPropertyReferenceException: Found cycle for field 'intVal' in type 'BigDecimal' for path 'b'
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CycleGuard.protect(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:468)
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$3.doWithPersistentProperty(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:231)
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$3.doWithPersistentProperty(MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver.java:226)

Hi,

I'm still getting this issue on spring-data-mongodb version 1.6.0.RELEASE. I've got a class with nested DateTime fields. This triggers the warning as shown below. Can you reopen the ticket please?

I should say that this does not cause the tests to fail. It does print out a long-ish, yet unnecessary warning text on your console.

This is still an issue in 1.6.1.RELEASE, should we open another ticket? I get an ugly WARN and stack trace when my application starts up. I don't see any workarounds mentioned in this ticket.

My issue is with Joda's DateTime as well.
This one is reported closed against already released versions, hence appears in the changelog of those. Feel free to open another ticket or maybe look around if one already has been created already?

I see similar error message after spring boot from 1.2.7 to 1.3.0 GA(including data mongodb 1.8.1 GA).

m.c.i.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver : Found cycle for field 'iChronology' in type 'DateTime' for path 'createdTime'

Any thought for it?

Confirm the same exception is present in my stacktrace using spring boot 1.3.2 RELEASE, mongodb 1.8.2 Release and joda-time 2.9.2:

org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.index.MongoPersistentEntityIndexResolver$CyclicPropertyReferenceException: Found cycle for field 'iChronology' in type 'DateTime' for path 'createdDate'

Code:

import org.joda.time.DateTime;

@CreatedDate
private DateTime createdDate;
